title: Kroger cutting hundreds of management jobs nationwide
text:
Kroger is cutting hundreds of local management jobs nationwide as it continues to struggle to compete with digital and discount rivals, Amazon and Walmart.

Hammered by the costs of home-delivery and store-pickup technologies as well as an ongoing price war in the grocery industry, Kroger's profit margins have taken a hit. The squeeze has hammered the company's stock and forced it to keep costs in line.

Kroger officials wouldn't specify the magnitude of the cuts, but acknowledged all 22 of its divisions in 35 states were scrutinizing management jobs under individual market presidents. The jobs are a target in tough times: They are well-paid and non-union, so they can be cut quickly and save money.

"Store operating divisions are constantly evolving to ensure they build the teams and leaders who will deliver an amazing experience for customers and associates both now and in the future," a Kroger spokeswoman said Wednesday.

"As part of ongoing talent management, many store operating divisions are evaluating middle management roles and team structures with an eye toward keeping resources close to the customer."

Kroger has about 450,000 employees nationwide.
